oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-08-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 17, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performers Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 932nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Jordanaires; Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper; Millie Kirkham; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- Love Has Finally Come My Way (Faron Young, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces the Jordanaires -- Each Day (Jordanaires) -- Faron Young introduces Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper -- Cheated Too (Wilma Lee & Stoney Cooper) -- Prince Albert commercial (Stoney Cooper, Faron Young) -- Faron Young talks -- Mississippi Sawyer -- Faron Young talks -- The Shrine Of St. Cecilia (Faron Young, Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham) -- Faron Young introduces Chet Atkins -- Johnson Rag (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Jordanaires (Musical group); Kirkham, Millie; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Young, Faron; Cooper, Wilma Lee, 1921-2011; Cooper, Stoney, 1918-1977
